required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Strict Need to Void After Same-day Discharge, Non-urogynecologic, Minimally Invasive Hysterectomy
clinical_study.official_title: To Void or Not to Void After Same-day Discharge, Non-urogynecologic, Minimally Invasive Hysterectomy, That is the Question

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients who are undergoing non-urogynecologic, minimally invasive (laparoscopic, robotic) hysterectomy who are discharged the day of surgery will be randomized to a strict need to void versus no need to void prior to discharge.
To determine if a strict versus liberal voiding trial following the aforementioned surgery in same day discharge patients increases rates of post-operative urinary retention, urinary tract infection (UTI), or re-presentation and if there is a difference in Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) time and costs.

primary_outcome.description: Will measure rates of urinary retention.

primary_outcome.measure: Rates of re-presentation to the ER
primary_outcome.description: Will measure rates of re-presentation to ER.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of time spent in PACU
secondary_outcome.description: This will assess the amount of time spent (in hours) in PACU.
This will assess the cost pertaining to the time spent in the PACU to determine if the time spent has a significant impact on the cost.

arm_group.arm_group_label: No strict need to void following surgery before discharge
arm_group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will have no strict need to void following surgery before they are discharged.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Strict need to void following surgery before discharge
arm_group.description: Participants randomized to this arm will have a strict need to void following surgery before they are discharged.

intervention.intervention_name: No Strict need to void following surgery
intervention.description: Certain patient will be randomized without a strict need to void prior to discharge following surgery.
intervention.arm_group_label: No strict need to void following surgery before discharge

intervention.intervention_name: Strict need to void following surgery
intervention.description: Certain patient will be randomized with a strict need to void prior to discharge following surgery.
intervention.arm_group_label: Strict need to void following surgery before discharge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women 18+ undergoing minimally invasive benign, non-urogynecologic hysterectomy
- English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- At the surgeons discretion based on amount of bladder dissection the patient can be removed from the study at the conclusion of surgery
- Any patient with a history of prior urologic procedures
- Patients with any baseline known urinary disease
- Any bladder injury at the time of surgery
- Any combined cases with other surgical services
- Patients undergoing surgery for prolapse or incontinence symptoms
- Patients who are ultimately not discharged the same day and remain in house overnight
